bullets.text: Appeals court keeps Lisa Cook on Fed board; Stephen Miran confirmed and voting, shaping FOMC dynamics as markets expect first 2025 rate cut this week.
BlackRock turns neutral on long Treasurys before cuts; strategists warn curve-steepening and volatility from policy shift if growth stays resilient.
US and China reach TikTok sale framework, signaling limited thaw that could de-risk some tech supply chains while broader tariff issues remain.
CBO says Trump’s tariffs are fueling inflation, underscoring policy trade-offs ahead of rate decisions and corporate margin pressures.
Alphabet reaches $3 trillion market cap, outperforming Nvidia year-to-date as AI-driven cash flows broaden beyond chipmakers.
Nvidia hit by China antitrust probe even as CoreWeave discloses $6.3B Nvidia order—highlighting regulatory risk amid still-frenetic AI demand.
Japan’s Nikkei 225 breaches 45,000 on optimism over U.S.-China talks and AI strength, reinforcing global risk-on sentiment.
Tesla shares surge, erasing year’s loss; Elon Musk buys $1B in stock, signaling insider confidence and improving EV sentiment.
PayPal adds peer-to-peer payment links with upcoming crypto support; banks worry deposit flight as stablecoins and tokenized cash offer higher yields.
Venezuela’s Maduro denounces U.S. boat strike as Trump authorizes another, raising regional security risks and potential oil-market sensitivities.
Israel seizes $1.5M from crypto wallets tied to Iran, underscoring growing use of blockchain analytics in sanctions enforcement.
China’s August data miss—retail sales and industrial output—deepens slowdown, pressuring commodities and global manufacturing supply chains.
